text: ill preface this by saying that i own an ipad and was not expecting atablet to perform at anywhere near that leveli have followed the early reviews closely and after seeing enough satisfied customers i figured id give the kindle fire hda tryi chose the basegb with special offers and my plan was to use it as a secondary ereader and a secondary or even tertiary vehicle for internet accesswhat ive found is a powerful little tablet so far completely free of the bugs and laggy speeds mentioned in the early reviewsin fact performance has so exceeded expectations that i consider this perhaps the years best purchasefirst off the look is nice its sleek i ordered the black model and though actually quite a bit heavier than id imagined its not heavy enough to be considered a negativethe display is fantastic and its quality was the first big surprise the touch screen performs incredibly well and to this point i have experienced immediate responseto the point where i have to say touch response so far is indistinguishable from my ipad based on early reviews this was not the case so i have been quite pleasantly surprised the fire is very user friendly and easy to intuitfor those who do not feel confident with navigation of a new device there is an immediate onscreen tutorial with an option to skip to guide youi first checked out the ereader functionmy books loaded immediately and easily from the cloud and i really like the functionality of the readeri am a big fan of the kindle app for the ipad and am far more accustomed to its functionality but the fire performedvery well and my only complaint is that when searching the definition of a word wikipedia is used versus google on the kindle for ipadphone apps which is a step down in quality imo but certainly a small complaint overall and in the quickorwords i searched the answer was attainable from that page and did not require going over to the wikipedia page as some have reportednext i checked out silk the web browserthis aspect of the fire probably received the most complaints as the early reviews came init was reported to lag and to crash frequently even on amazons own sitei expected this to be the case as i tested it but i found that these problems must already have been addressed your tablet loads the newest version of the software upon your registration in subsequent updates as my experience was the ability to browse quickly and flawlessly across a number of varying websitesthis was the second surprise for me as i expected a far lower quality and especially a slower speed i couldnt be happier with what ive experienced so fari browsed the app store and found it very functional and easy to maneuver i set up my gmail within a matter of seconds and i looked through a variety of sales and offers at no time have i found slow speeds poor touch responses or any laggingthe kindle fire hd has exceeded my expectations in every way and i still cant believe i got it fortaxthis thing is an incredible bargain and so far its quality of performance holds its own against my ipad something i absolutely did not expect at this priceim sure as i become more familiar with the fire the reasons for the price difference between it and the ipad will become more apparent but when you consider the main reasons for which i purchased the fire it holds up marvelously wellagain this may be the years best purchase from a value standpointso fari wouldnt hesitate to recommend it to anyoneenjoyupdatesince writing this review back in october ive purchasedmore for my kidsin perhaps the greatest test of speed and function namely being easy fast and fun enough to be preferred by children these tablets have continued to impress and have proved that they are indeed a game changer in the world of budget tablets withmonths of rather heavy use under my belt i have experienced absolutely no technical difficulties and i remain a very satisfied customer i therefore continue to highly recommend this excellent tablet

if you read my fire tv review you know that i am tough on amazon when it comes to their own items it needs to deliver quality for the price point to earn stars from me please take the time to read my entire review and feel free to ask questions i will do my best to respond to them as i can and update the review to reflect those answers and other things i discover along the wayfirst my background i own many amazon kindles bw fire gen fire gen as well as apple ipad gensamsung noteand have an lg g smartphone had a samsung s before that notebooks chromebooks etc i have also used many other products including the fire hdx line i have a solid computer background as well but honestly i am more of a casual user when it comes to tablets like this oneamazon has changed many things over the life of the fire product line adding and removing features like camerasthe first generation had one but the second generation removed them but not they are backthey are all useful devices but each one has its own niche so to speak so make sure whatever you get has the features that are important to younow to this model this is like a big smartphonewhich is a big difference from past kindles it is more compact lighter and yet still very usable in fact for me the shrinking of size increases the usefulness i find that i use my smartphone way more than my tabletseven the smaller fire hd and samsung note tablets so i am expecting this to replace more of that on the couch usage which is great since it so much less expensive than most smartphones that means you can feel less bad about scratches that might occur or the accidental drops i am guilty of boththe screen is very goodcertainly not the top of the line but nice even if you factor paying twice the retail for it it is bright sharp with the same resolution as pastcomparing past kindle firesst generationinch xpixel resolution atppind generationinch xpixel resolution atppird generationinch xresolution atppi the first step up in resolutionth generationinch xppi this is the twin to this model and was just releasedwhereas thisinch model hasxppi that makes this display higher or the same resolution than any of the past kindle fires with the exception of the more expensive hdx it makes it sharper with more detail per inch than any of the past kindle fires of this smaller size again except for the hdx yet this is the cheapest fire yet which is quite impressivenow while amazon may love my giving thisinch fire astar rating they wouldnt like this next sentence there is absolutely no reason to even consider the newly releasedinch firemore gets you a less sharpdetailed screen more weight more bulk look at the extra space on the sides next to the screen of the newinch and the newinch and the only improvements is a second speaker and a larger screenin my opinion you should consider thisinch fire or consider spending twice as much to step up to the fire hdx with many improvements mayday button higher resolution faster processor dualband dual antenna mimo wifi and longer battery life the hdx has some issues with a blue halo around the screen so read reviews of that before jumpingso now that i have talked you out of the fireand covered some of the reasons for considering the firehdx lets talk more about the fire performanceappsit is quick but i am never happy enough lol responsive and like apple productsit just works now one plus and minus with all kindlesfires are that you can not use any app from googles app store that means you have to wait for apps to be brought into amazons app store which seems to be slow at getting new releases and new updates this is really an issue for amazon and one that still needs to be fixed the plus to this is that amazon keeps some of the junky apps out of the system and once they make it to amazons app store they are proven safe and generally work better than the fresh apps because bugs have been worked outamazons own apps are very well integrated into this and past fires they keep improving them and adding features without adding cost if you have prime you get streaming tv and movies free ebooks and now prime music if you have prime the added free content you get on the fire makes it a real standout against everything elsei use my firefor reading emails surfing the internet watching videos some of the time and playing some gamesapps like imdb i have found that it meets or exceeds what i have come to expect from these things in terms of performance and reliability are there bugs or glitches yes but less than my lg smartphone has and less than my samsung tab hassizeabout the size of the new large phones is very nicenot too big but not too small it is more portable feeling than theinch tablets and it is easy to hold it is fun to be part of the cool club without droppingtimes as much or signing ayear contractqualityamazon has proven overtime that they can make quality products and this is no exception at under a hundred dollars there is pretty much nothing else that is this feature packed with this finish quality i have experienced no quality issues and do not expect anything given amazons solid historybattery lifeso far so good i was able to stream video and surf the internet for well overhours without any hiccups from a device this compact with such a large screen that seems quite impressivesounddecent but apple products are cleaner sounding to me volume is usable in most situations but not necessarily in noisy outside situationsi am sure i have forgotten something so please feel free to ask questions this is my own opinion and while i dont know everythingi do my best to deliver honest reviews since reviews help me so much when i shopif you are in the market for a little tablet and have prime you have to decide between this fireor theinch hdx for twice the cost thisinch adds the rear camera and most of the performance while being smaller lighter at half the price

for the low price this tablet really does more than expectedthe camera isnt great however i always use my phone for a camera so that doesnt effect mehere are some of the pros and conspros low cost yet high techgreat screen quality of course there is better out there but it looks great as issmooth and responsiveeasy access to amazon prime contenteasy to wirelessly share content to a tvbattery lifeweb browser works greatcons doesnt have some apps android users are used to havingcamera quality isnt great and no flashless extra features than some higher priced tablets havei opted to go with the gb version with no adsthe ads arent a big deal but i figured i would pass on having them on my screenno matter what version you pick they all do the same thingsthe gigs may or may not matter to youandgigs both arent very large but if you want to predownload some tv shows moviesmusic before a vacation then you may want to look into getting the larger gigif you will always have internet connection then it isnt much a problem since you have unlimited cloud storage and can download to your device or stream at anytime you have internetoverall if you want an amazon tablet and you want the best go with the hdx serieshowever if you want an amazing tablet but dont want to spend as much then these new hdseries are greatfor me and my uses the hdis the perfect fiti would suggest theover thefor most buyersthe onlythings thehas over theare a larger screen and dual speakerssure the dual speakers is kind of nice but the screen is actually lower quality than theat ppi thekeeps the same resolution as its last rd generationthehowever has ppi which make its screen a bit more crisphere are some of my thoughtssize the size is goodi prefer that it is a smaller size for ease of carryingas long as you see well up close thisis a great sizebattery life very sufficient for my needsthe kindle hdxs have a little longer battery life however thishour specd battery life has been lasting a long time and never getting too low for my usessound sound isnt badit is comparable to a laptop from a few years backthehas only a mono speaker but it is loud enough and crispi find it is plenty for watching a tv show or moviefor music i prefer a speaker or headphonesbut that goes for pretty much any tabletcheck out my youtube earthling for some more information on this tablet

im starting off my saying im not just antikindleive owned an original kindle and a nd gen kindle fire hd i loved them bothmy husband owns one he loves it my kids played mine all the time so much they loved themso for christmas we decided to get my older two children their own kindle fires we selected this model due to a tremendous price discount on cyber mondaywe opened them up at christmas and now my daughter is constantly frustrated she continues to get a message warning her that storage space is getting low and it shuts the wireless connection down so she cant watch the streaming video that is part of kindle freetime or even download the little games in freetimeso being the tech family we are im an it tech my husband is a computer engineer so we arent stupid when it comes to tech devices we began looking into thisi know that this is the gb model i see that it is advertised as above as havingof that gb available for the useri call bs on thatsee attached photoof the entiregb available according to the above advertising you get considerably lesswhy is amazon telling me that i get that much space available when their system applications stuff i cant uninstall either take up some of that space and then system files take ofof a gig on this one andof a gig on my sons kindlewhen i click on system to see what it includes it says this catergory includes system cache logs texttospeech files and other system files i cant see what it isthese people knew how much of their random system files and settings would eat into my storage spaceso dont give me a little sales pitch that i getwhen i dontso i did some diggingmy husbandsgb kindle fire hd nd gen lets us know thatgb are availablewhich means the android os the kindle fire os thats on top of the android system and all the system files and behind the scenes stuff are planned to take upgbwhich would be about rightsystem files user accounts system settings etc use up aboutgb of the advertisedgb of user storageso amazon should be honest and sayyou get gb of storage not im highly disappointed in this its frustrating and disappointingmy personal recommendation to friends and family will definitely not include this type of kindle again

i was very surprised to find that i absolutely love this little devicesurprised because i had the very first fire and the very first fire hd and ended up giving them to family members because i just didnt like themi was hesitant to try theinch since i didnt like theinch and was pleasantly surprised to find that i really really liked itit was easy to set upemail and my amazon purchases loaded very quicklyi have the kindle pw but usually do all of my reading on the ipad mini kindle app due to the fact that i like the larger screen over the pwi only use the pw when i am reading at night in bed if i cant sleepthat is why i am surprised that reading on the fire hdis just so nice and appealingi like the feel and build of the fireit is heavier in the hand than the pw but the heaviness adds to the feeling of qualityit has a nice solid feel and is very comfortable to hold one handedthe screen for viewing videos is absolutely beautiful i think better than the ipad minii bought this mainly to have the text to speech function and it worked very well with the book i was currently readingthe speaker is not that bad but i almost always use headphones so the mono speaker is no big deal for megb is not a lot since you really get less than that for your own content but i currently have two episodes of soa on it an audio book one game and five books and i still have just under gb left to usethe battery life is pretty goodmuch better than the previous fire hd i had triedi use the ipod touch at work mainly to stream the instant videos and my music never liked reading on it but with the larger screen on the fire hd my ipod is going to be sitting at home while the mini fire is going to be my constant companionnow on to my complaintswhich are very fewi wish the back of the fire hd was a little more skid resistant and i really wish the lighting could be turned down to almost blackfor me at the lowest setting it is still way too bright to use comfortably in a dark roomi know there is an app out there to help with this but the device should be able to accommodate almost zero light itselfalso i really wish that amazon would adopt the swipe up and down the screen to adjust your light settingkobo was able to do this to their aura hd with a firmware update and i really wish amazon would do this tooa truly immersive reading experience should mean being able to make all your adjustments while still reading without having to stop reading and go thru menus to reach the settings you need ambient light sensor is still having the device decide what is best and you still need to make adjustments to what you likeall in allgood job on this oneits small enough to go everywhere with you and heavy enough to feel well builtupdatei never thought i would ever say this because i always have loved my ipad minibut i am reading more on this little fire and my mini has been sitting in the drawer ever since i unboxed the fire

first let me say that i love amazon and feel it truly provides a great shopping place for momsi buy many items in which i am very happy with through its website and this is perhaps why i am so disappointed with this purchasei do not make snap decisions and take time to research an item before buyingi also rarely spendon any given itemi bought this tablet because of the marketing done on the product and what the commercials said this tablet was capable ofi saw the commercial where the tab slid off a car hood and survived hitting the concrete as well as the commercial where it took a tumble down the stairs and lastly the tumble it took in the tumbling mechanismmy tablet was not so fortunateit took a mereft fall and the screen shattered beyond the point of usethe commercials lead one to believe it should be able to survive this but mine did nothad i known it was going to be like all the other tablets out there i would have taken better precautions to ensure it didn’t have a chance to breaki feel that amazon has wrongly misled its customer’s in its marketing efforts to sale this producti have only had the tablet formonths and am no longer able to use iti called amazon to voice my concern and was not offered much other than a replacement that cost me almost as much as a brand new deviceso be cautious if buying this tablet it is just like all the others out therebuy a case to protect it and treat it as you do your other devices as it is not indispensable as the commercials claim

incredible little machineads on the main pages but they are not bothersomefunctions totally intuitive no learning curve at alli hated the kindle bought a nook and amazon has now done the hardest thing in retail they have earned back a customer they lostcombine the quality of this product with prime and their renewed commitment to actually serving the customer and they are unbeatablei have an ipad and this device completely replaced it inhoursdoes everything more reliably and more intuitivelyabout the only thing the ipad still wins at is linking with itunesso if you are an itunes music only person this might still be a difficult questionbut this fire does everything else better than my ipad email videotv web browse readerthe app war still hinges on android being twitchy cheaper wider and apple being more reliable narrow pricier but i rarely use apps except games which are fine either way if anything they are better organized and easier to get at on the fire if you are a gamereverything is easier to get at heremuch better devicemuch less expensiveway way better customer servicei rarely leave reviews but amazon has hit the retail ball out of the park with prime and firethey are winning againcongrats

i have had the tablet for a week i am a member of the apple evil ecosystem with iphone s ipad mini ipad air and macbook air while having another tablet is a bit absurd the fire hdis much more pocketable than the ipad mini and much less expensive to replace if lost therefore the niche i use it for is to carry it around while out and about much like my iphone with its most direct competitor being the iphoneplus but with a screen just big enough to read comfortablyi might use it as my alarm clock since the clock has an excellent night stand viewsince i am not a member of the googleandroid evil ecosystem inability to use those appsmusic is irrelevant to me if anything i would want the fire to be more like a cheaper smaller ipad i would like my apple newsmagazine subscriptions to be fully usable with fire apps my national geographic subscription works fine on the fire as does my nyt digital subscription but the fire nyt app is more limited than the apple one however there is enough common appsinteroperability eg outlook exchange onenote not to mind leaving the apple realm and entering the amazon dominionthe build quality of the tablet seems solid though thinnerlighter would be nicer and battery life and screen quality are excellent the accuracy and fluidity of the touch screen are comparable with an ipad the tablet seems quick but sometimes lags but so do my ipads i have not found the software to be buggy most steps and features are fairly consistent with other tablets and therefore are not hard to learn amazon should consider adding a may day option that users could purchase if they are new to tabletsthis tablet is best for something thats easy to pocket but big enough to read many could use it comfortably as a primary tablet but a higher end amazon tablet would better fill that role the size of the fire hdalso seems to eliminate many reasons for having a kindle device except for reading in the sun or next to a lightsensitive bed mate

for the price you cannot go wrong with this tablet it actually does more than i expectedit is similar to the ipad mini that i used to owni actually have owned and still own many apple products but wanted to use this tablet to watch my prime videos and listen to music with the prime musicthe app store is okay for the kindle though not as good as the android and apple stores but sufficethe camera is an awful mp that is very noisy photography term for pixelatedthe mono speaker is such old technology the touch screen is not as responsive as my iphonethough these may seem like many complaints once again this product is less thanother tablets for that price were just phony toys for kidsyou could actually use this at your work or at schoolyou will not find a tablet like this from another company for under if you want to buy theone then formore you can i do like the fact that i can fit this in my pocket but is big enough to type notes and watch moviesi would recommend this product to my friends and family and to others and i will buy another one soon in blue in a couple weeks

warning if you have a limited data plan this device should only be used if you have unlimited or lots of data as it constantly transfers large amounts of data without notification even if you never stream video or musicthe first day we fired this up it used over gb of data just updating and installing free junk we did not request or wantwe paid extra not to get the adsand i would imagine that they constantly update and use even more datai have owned everykindle since the originalone and loved them allbut this one greatly disappointed mewe are rural and data is expensive but this device seems to assume that everyone has unlimited datathere does not seem to be anyway to limit its data consumption so every time you enable wireless you will have no control over how much data it usesthe touch screen seems far worse than the original fire requiring several taps to select thingsmy wife downloaded an audible book and when she tried to open it the second time the screen did not respond so she tapped it twice which then deleted the book with no notice very poor design and not nearly as well done as the original fire that we each use for hours every dayi spent my engineering career designing computers and i regard this as a device that should not have been released until the bugs were worked outbefore you sell a product the software should be updated and not require a huge update right after power upwe bought this for the size and bluetooth streaming but may have to return it if there is no way to fix the data consumption

if you love kindles you will love thethree of us in my household have the earlier generation kindle fire hd which we won’t part with one also has a very early kindle which he reads in bed used to it it has a light won’t give it upi am not quite an early adopter but close and i worried about buyingof these sight unseen one for my sister and two as prizes for children in a low income neighborhoodyesterday i asked my husband to try out reading his current book on a newhe didn’t put it down even though it as yet has no case and he is used to reading kindles like a book—open and closemy joy was finding all my music there all my books and emails etc who cares about the camera my husband is a professional and loves his various nikons he won’t use anything elsei care for those quick shots to capture the deer nibbling at my shrubs the dog doing something adorable the children caught in fun “i thought you were reading”i am reading no fabulous shots but it’s in my kindlei haven’t given it the full workout but i will before we deregister them and give them to worthy schoolchildrenbut they are so light and so reasonable i am thinking of buying one for my handbag… commuting airplanes doctors and dentists offices with their interminable waits coffee shops…and keeping my earlier joy the original kindle hd at bedside and syncingbased on this two day experience i won’t buy stock in amazon they can’t make a profit on these delightful and inexpensive

let me stress that for the feature i enjoy most you must paymore to get the gb version in order to fully utilize though works with gb this is the feature that allows you to download a huge library of amazon prime free videos including many top hbo and showtime series as well as amazons transformed as i am on a trainhours a day this offline viewing is worth many times to price of this device just make sure you have the gb version as the gb version ultimately has only about gb free storage making it essentially a cloud device also when downloading videos i suggest choose the better downloading format which is the middle choice between lower and higher resolution and storage i find this to be perfectly acceptable from a viwing standpointoverall the screen resoloution and sharpness is better than i expected i agree that this can also serve as a terrific ereader and if you do not have an ipad a fun device to play games on i find the touchscreen not to always be perfectly responsive but am guessing this can be fixed by a software updatefantastic value overall

i bought them for my boys its a perfect size for them they keep them on the charger while at school and can play them until time for bed its not my first time getting a kindle fire but first for my boys the quality is great and they are having a blast using them

i have a kindle firest generation and i love it i didnt need the hdg tablet but i wanted something smaller and i love this size the price is so fantasticfor a tablet is such a deali wasnt sure how i would like reading on a smaller device but i actually like it better even better than my kindle ereaderi was pleasantly surprised to find that this little tablet really is much faster than my larger one and it seems to use less battery power i got lots of free apps and loaded it up with books musicand photos this didnt slow it down music does take up more storage than anything elsei had no trouble downloading books audiobooks music and pictures the tablet is very easy to navigate despite the smaller size i dont even need a stylusthis is my fourth kindle product i bought the st and rd generation ereaders and thetablet and they just keep making them better i have never had any issues other than a couple charging issues when thefirst came out but it was fixed quicklythestreams very quickly no glitches and looks fantastic it is faster than my laptop and larger tablet its amazingi do wish there was a flash for the camera especially since it is both front and rear facing i would use it more this is the only con i have foundthis is another great amazon product that comes with all the extra features they offer their customersi used to think people were crazy for reading on their phones but this isnt much bigger than some and i could read on this all day it truly is a stealupdatei am still loving this kindle i use this more then my ereader orfire i pretty much use it all the timedont get the battery saver app it would sometimes make the tablet freezei also like that on this fire i can have my reading background be a light green color i was using sepia on the other fire this may not be new to the hd fires but it is new to me and i like it
i would recommend this for anyone

i bought this tablet for myyear old son this past year i have spenton a cheap rca tablet andon a google nextbook thenon the hisense pro last year for christmas needless to say all of them have broke since thenfor being under adollars i cant praise it enough in comparison to the other tablets in that price bracket compared to the cheap tables i bought before this tablet is glorioussince i bought it for my son i really appreciate the sturdy structure very easy to hold and use for small hands but it also fits very comfortably in my own hands its actually easier to hold than my own tablet the fire hdxthe sleek back and pointy corners make my hands cramp up i think i dropped it five times on my face before i got the case which makes it a lot easier to holdthe picture looks fantastic for the price range very clear and bright no glare if youve bought cheap tablets before then you know how terrible the glare can be the sound is decent the touch is super easy and sensitive my son has no problems navigating through pocket minecraft added kindle unlimited freetime for kids and i am in lovei have had no problems with any lagging or crashes or even when ive stole it to surf on the interneti made the mistake of buying myyear old andyear old leappad s last year and greatly regret the money trap that comes with it games loaded directly onto the leappad range anywhere fromtoper game if your in the market for buying a tablet for your children you cannot beat this nugget with the free time cheaper full of games books kids movies that personally have my two younger kids drooling over my sons new tabletim waiting for the kids case to come out and it will be perfecton a different note i have thought about buying one for myself just to fit easily into my purse for easy reading when travelingi hope the price stays the same because i will be buying these for christmas gifts for pretty much all my nieces and nephews

expectations from the start it feels thicker clunkier and heavier though it is lighter than the larger nexusthe screen almost looks to be set further into the device its resolution isxppi which is a equal build quality for less and with gb of ram it should handle light mobile games email and some light web browsing with aplomb but when you get to the software thats where things go off the rails for me amazon skinned over the lovely android os with their own proprietary features much to the detriment of the user experience perhaps its because im used to a pure android experience but the devices seems seriously hamstrung by the fire os you lose access to the google play store you lose access to a synced chrome and all its bookmarks with no way to import them you lose access to the device synchronicity youre accustomed to and youre forced into an ecosystem that is geared towards amazon consumption at the cost of being truly user friendly i found myself constantly frustrated by anemic though it does sport an hdr mode and a wide array of editing tools the pictures will never be anything to write home about especially in low light conditions the screen size is frustrating for me tapping and touching with normal sized fingers and hubby couldnt do squat with his much bigger hubby paws amazon does sport its own app store but more than a few of the versions of the apps available while seemingly identical to their google app and apple app store cousins are usually a few versions behind because lets face it there are two big dogs on the app block and it doesnt make sense to spend a bundle on development for the two little dogs with very little market penetration amazon and windows amazon has also locked the bootloader which means no third party development is available which is another huge upside for normal android devices and a hinderance for kindlesi like having access to my amazon prime benefits i like being able to stream my free video and audio any time soon the proprietary frustrating nature of the os the ads on the lock screen the focus on the amazon experience and not the customer experience the lack of synchronicity the screen and some personal experience the memory on my first device was corrupted and the charging port was borked amazon sent a replacement nextday air but after several rounds with their customer service chat to figure out how to connect the device to my tv for a true hd video experiencedifferent chats got medifferent failed methods i eventually gave up and resigned myself to asubhd screen for the foreseeable future i also dont know how i only havegb of space on a gb device when it arrives too small to download a movie and very little space for apps media or really anything ive used samsung galaxy devices lg devices asus devices and nexus devices kindle is dead last in my user experiencei wanted to like my kindle i wanted one for some time amazon shot for the moon with their kindle devices and instead for me shot themselves in the foot perhaps i expected too much if its for youngsters you have a relatively well built relatively inexpensive device that they can stream the occasional video play a few games and read a few books for a grown up youre better off buying a grown up device i received the above products free of charge from third voice marketingi am not obligated to provide a positive or my fire hdarrived this afternoon so i have just begun to test itill update this review tomorrow after i have put its features through a bit more of a trial but so far im delightedi have a bit of experience with computers kindles and android tablets so this is not i hope an uninformed reviewfirst off the tablet arrived in perfect condition beautifully packaged it was a joy to unbox and a cinch to set up i plugged it into an outlet and watched as it automatically booted up for the first time no problem neither was there any problem connecting to my existing amazon account and gmail account the system update took a while to download and install and it took even longer to get the battery charged up fully in part because i decided to use the tablet while it was chargingthe tablet itself is a solid well made slab it feels like something that is not fragile and that will last its comfortable to hold in one hand with squared edges that dont jab into ones fingers the way the edges of my thinner asus memo padtend to do it is not a featherweight but rather it weights exactly the advertisedounces the same as the venerable kindleit will largely replacei purchased it primarily as an ereader and have tested that function i rarely read in direct sunlight but often read in bed so the backlit screen is perfect for me the text is very sharp and the entire kindle reading experience is a joy text to speech in public domain books uses a pleasant female robovoice im quite happy with it i havent yet tried audible books or audio books from my public library but im quite certain they will work after i fiddle around to install the overdrive app the single speaker is loud enough for most purposesthe silk browser is fast and smooth im using it to write this review and am very pleased with the implementation of the swipe keyboard for writing word prediction is accurate the action is smooth web pages come up as quickly as they would on any of my laptop machinesmaybe even a little more quicklyamazon prime videos load and play smoothly the six inch screen is quite big enough for pleasant viewing given that i wanted a light weight device i could easily skip in a coat pocket or a back pocketi took a few test photos with the camera it works but it is only two megapixels still i have found my two megapixel cell phone camera capable of taking surprisingly good macro photographs of wildflowers and insects my initial results with this tablets camera were a bit disappointing but i have hopes of figuring out how to take better shots and will report back tomorrowto be continuedi have updated and expanded this review on my blog page google search for lake norfork adventures note the spelling of norfork or else you wont find the page that review includes some tips for sideloading apps but i devote most of my attention to the camera i do a bit of macro nature photography to help in identifying wild flowers and insects ive posted a few photos taken with this camera it is surprisingly useful

i cannot tell you how much i love the kindle fire hdthe clarity of the screen is extremely impressive for as small as it is that part surpassed all my expectations it has convenient volume buttons on the side and from what i can tell the speaker quality is pretty good for something so tiny it fits perfectly in my purse so i can take it anywhere with me and it is on the light side so it doesnt weigh my bag downmy all time favorite feature on this is the goodreads button i have been saying for a few years now how much easier it would be if ereaders synced right up to goodreads and it finally happened instead of logging onto goodreads to update my progress or to add a new book to my currently reading shelf all i have to do is tap the screen hit the goodreads button and i can update everything from there it even tells me about how long it takes the average reader to read the book im currently on maybe its the book nerd in me but i was so excited about that feature that i literally shouted out loud in excitement when i saw itanother feature that spoke to the bibliophile in me was the related books feature as you are on the home screen scrolling through books it will show you a few other books you may be interested in purchasing based on the subject of that book i received this in exchange for an honest review and myhonest opinion is that compared to the original kindle fire with theinch screen that i already had this is by far my favorite one i highly recommend it if you are mainly using it for reading you will get over its small size rather quickly when you see the amazing features and incredible screen quality

i bought this device as a birthday present for my daughter the major selling points were the camera and the parental controls — my daughter loves to read and play games and having a system that requires the former before the latter will get her to read and learn even moresetup for my account and hers was a little bit more time consuming than expected but went relatively smoothly we downloaded our first book and some apps established some amazon gift cards as a payment solution and set up the incentive system above under my daughters profile we got the unit yesterday and my daughter had doneminutes of reading before i woke up this morning so im very pleased with the resulti would have given this a four or fivestar review on that basis however we discovered this morning that my daughter cannot access the camera from her profile there is an explicit lineitem for camera access in parental controls which is switched to unblocked but it doesnt make a difference its completely absent from her profilei spent a lot of time trying to figure this out before calling tech support but wasnt able to get resolution from them eitheri have developed a shortterm workaround where i have downloaded a camera application which i can enable my daughter to access through her profile however its not as good as the onboard interface for the camera in addition because its now classified as an application it is included in the parental control time limits which i set up for her account that means that once shes used up her time on applications for the day she can no longer use the camerai am otherwise very pleased with the unit but not having a good camera on board because of a software bug is annoying im waiting to hear back from technical support on this issue — they promised a response in a few days if this issue is resolved in a satisfactory manner i will be amending this review if not ill be sadly returning the unit

i bought two of these as christmas gifts for my almost andyear oldsboth of their ipod touches were getting older and they had asked for replacementsi thought the bigger sized tablets would be a welcome replacementi also wanted to utilize the prime video and music i already pay forimagine my surprise when i tried to set up the household profiles which is widely advertised as the best thing evathis advertised feature was what helped me decide on these devices vs an android tablet to quote directly from the kindle hd product page with profiles create unique profiles for up toadults andchildren so family members can share a tablet and still keep personalized settings like email and social accounts home screen carousel and even their own level in games like angry birds my plan was to set up a kid profile for each child so they could each enjoy their own device nowhere in all the reading i did on amazoncom was there any discussion of what features are turned off for the child profilesheres the real deal the children profiles are locked down tighter than ft knoxthere is no email no access to social networks no music and no browser for a child profileonly videos books and appsthis probably is a great fit for ageand under ironically the age range for freetime unlimitedfor myyear olds though a child profile would be a huge step backwards from the functionality they enjoyed with their ipod touches no music reallythe other big drawback to the child profiles is they literally cannot pull down any of their own contentit is left to me the adult to select what they have access toat the individual book or app levelthat makes sense for ayear old but not an option that interests this busy mom with two internetsavvy childrenso what does that leavenot muchafter fighting with their kid profiles including a teen setting that only seems to allow the user to change from landscape to portrait orientation i deleted themi have two devices two kids and only one other adult profile available on my prime accountso im left with just one choicehave both devices use the main prime accountthis gives both devices access to the music and the ability for the user to pull down their own content this also means we myself and my two kids are all sharing the same library not a huge deal but if i have any books or videos in my library that i dont want them to read im going to have to manage that myselfso much for all these wonderful family controls if i had only one device i might add the second adult profile and call it a daybut i have two devices not onethe kids love their devicesthey were able to get up and running very quicklyi turned off click purchases for each device and added a pin for video purchases which i believe will limit the damage they could do one of them did buy an app yesterday without realizing it i need to dig in and figure out what happened therewhat amazon needs for the kindle hd is another profile option for familiesi would love to see a teen profile that looks more like the adult tablet settings with email music and social network accessi am bummed that i cant take advantage of the screen time controls that is a nice feature of the kid profiles that i cant use because of the other limitationsin the meantime amazon should do a better job of explaining what isnt available with the child profilesmost of my frustration comes from the sense of being oversold the wonderful world of amazon freetime and family profilesonce i figured out that it wasnt a good fit for my family i was left with very little functionality to manage my kids devicesedited to add a friend who is wrestling with this same issue shared her discovery that adding the second adult profile to the prime account does not grant access to prime video or musicapparently you can share books only via the family librarythis makes the above quote from the hd product page even more misleadingthis is different than sharing the prime accountaccording to the help page it only grants the shipping to up to four household members free or paid amazon prime members can share their shipping benefits with up to four additional family members living in the same household if you purchase a prime membership for a small business you may invite up to four coworkers to shop with this corporate account other amazon prime membership benefits such as prime instant video prime music and the kindle owners lending library cant be shared

so myyear daughter ended up buying the fire hdwith the money she had saved after her old android tablet had died being quite familiar with the android platform i set this up for her so i decided to post a review on what my thoughts were of this android variant tabletfirst off if you are heavily vested in google services mail maps books movies etc you should pass on this tablet this is not a google services friendly tablet yes there are ways to root it and get google services installed and running but that also means voiding the warranty in doing so you can sideload google apps without rooting the device but that also means sideloading the services framework as well as the account manager to get many of the google apps to run and many wont run this also requires you to download the newest version of the app and sideload it each time google updates the app so in short with a lot f work and upkeep you may be able to get some of the google apps to work again this is a walled garden and not a google services friendly tabletnow for the tablet as it is an amazon branded android variant tablet first off fordollars you get a lot of bang form your buck hardware wise the tablet feels solidly built and not cheap feeling at all budget tablet wise this is a pretty good tablet only gb of storage though mine actually showsgb free storage when i look at it with es file explorer but you also have amazons cloud services for music pictures and such so it evens out again with solid hardware this is a pretty good dealnow for the not so good amazon needs to do more work in the software side of this tablet to start their profiles need work even a teenager profile doesnt allow for you to share installed apps camera etc to the child profile only content from the main amazon account holder so this means that after creating a profile for my daughter so i could ensure there were curfew times on the tablet she couldnt get access to many of the features of the tablet like using the camera nor could she get access to any apps installed through the amazon app storelikewise the parental controls for blockingunblocking access to the camera and others features only works on the main amazon account profile what good are parental controls that dont work on child profiles additionally the parental controls pin is the same pin used to make purchases if you enabled that security feature the two should be separate pins then theres the installing of free apps it still requires you to put in the pin to install apps marked as free why so my daughter has to come to me every time she wants to install a free app from the app store just so i can input the pinon top of all that many of the popular apps for android are incompatible with the fire hd tablets like instagram and oovoo for example so again it requires you to sideload the apps and then theres no guarantee they will work this makes for a sorely lacking app store overall i was less than impressed with amazons app store and the selection of decent apps for the amazon firein the end i ended up just letting my daughter use the tablet under my profile and blocking the features i didnt want her to have access to through parental controls and security settings the profiles feature was just too meager in its functionalityoverall if you are heavily vested in amazon services then this tablet is for you however if you prefer the more openness of a straight android tablet you might find the fire hd line a bit frustrating my daughter said she much preferred her old tablet over this one but overall she was able to basic internet access and of course the fact that me and my husbands room started to look like a dementeduncontrollable library with a mind of its own affected the decision tooim trying to be super realistic and it really tormented me to take off one star but the only thing that i can find negative about the kindle is the battery life and it has to be mentioned everything else is absolutely and utterly awesome at least for mei didnt know i would be able to do so much besides reading books on my kindle i seriously didnt expect that muchin fact due to chronic illness my eyesight is so crappy that reading became more and more of a chore and i love readingbut i can easily and without eye strain read on it backlit screen is actually giving some rest to my eyes andshorter pages that are intuitive and if even a person like me who proudly carried a flip phone into theand never used a touch screen before can figure it out you can toothe images are crisp games run well weeeell that gyroscope can get out of whack if you lie down to read its possible to turn it off the kindle became my constant companion as i wake up and go about my day and whatever internet related need arises i just carry the kindle around check the facebook bank accounts look up a business or an address read the news go through the emails its pretty awesome all around even with fairly heavy walking dead games on it it still has room and you can store all amazon purchased stuff on their cloud server so i intend to keep it that waywith all this awesomeness however comes a drawback thats not a big issue internet avoiding all streaming content including your candy crush whatnot etc the battery still sucks i know the little thing is trying to cope with high definition videos constant wifi connection battery almost entirelythat said i still love my kindle i baby it terribly its got a matching case and a long ss charger cord that sadly only works when you position it just right insert it just so and dont breathe on it hmm that came out wrong and you did it all by yourself smiles the autocorrectbut for the sake of beauty skys the limit so i hope my kindle lives a long happy life it certainly before i go on i should point out that the unit i used was a refurbished specimen purchased from amazonthe device seems pretty well made there was a bit of adhesive for the screen at the bezel but beyond that the unit was sound it is much heavier and thicker than i would expectthough the screen is pretty small at this dimension it is clear and sharp whether it be reading an ebook or watching videos it can be quite bright brightness varies a lot from the reading vs video app the video from amazon was dim and i needed to dial up the brightness considerablythe interface is much more androidy than the kindle i had a few years ago and i think this is generally a good thing the other androidy thing is that it is relatively easy to load the play store on the kindle and those apps that i use from device to device worked well for me like outlook the native amazon apps have improved as well with an acceptable mail client and a calendar that was ok though i had to specify device settings on the google calendar remote device management page otg cable function worked just finereally the big deal breaker for me is the battery life which was abysmal using mixed reading and video i might have gottenhours out of the device which makes it very limited in use for longer trips and this was in airplane mode on and the screen brightness reduced as much as tolerable whether this is a realistic trade off for the low price is up to the user i suppose but finding the device less useful than a gennexusboth in speed and battery life gives me little reason to keep the device either as an e reader or media consumption device the kindle and amazon video apps on these other devices make the proprietary importance of having a marginally useful tablet questionable for me it is worth having longer battery life and a faster processor at a higher price

i got this as a gift a few days ago and i was excited because ive wanted to try out a kindle fire for a while well in some ways i love it and in some ways i didnt im a bit of a tech geek so this tablet was a little dissapointing in the hardware area what did i like i actually love the interface and i love that all my amazon stuff was automatically accessible upon set up i like the blue light night time reading filter and i like the way the email app is set up i liked the size of the screen which surprised me since i never thought id like a smaller screen too and as other reviewers have pointed out the screen quality is awesome now to the stuff that made me return it in spite of all that good stuff this tablet felt like it was borderline obsolete its got a kind of chunky design and is very heavy for its size it weighs more than otherandinch tablets ive used this unfortunately makes it slightly akward to hold for someone like me who has smaller wrists the other deciding factors for me were the ram and the lack of a memory card slot gb isnt much and while i understand that amazon provides cloud storage its still annoying to have to go through and delete things off the device and redownload something if your space is full and only gb of ram makes the fire feel more like a lowend tablet when in some ways it feels more like a midrange tablet its not as fast as my other tablet with gb of ram and its noticeable now people who dont care about these things or people who are in the market for their first tablet will probably love the kindle fire series of tablets and id recommend the hdof all of them just for the better screen resolution but people who are more tech savvy probably wouldnt be happy with this when there are other tablets similar in size and only slightly more expensive with better specsbottom line for me i love what the fire hdhas the potential to be for now im sticking with my samsung

i have had this tablet for aboutdays now and i am very disappointed and often annoyed by it for the most part it works fine but there are some things that glitch consistently some things i dont seem to have user control over and some interface things that are just frustratingfor example every time i turn the screen on there is an ad from amazon every time ive poked around in the settings and cant seem to find the option to turn this off or to set a picture of my choice insteadevery time i hit the circle to go to my home screen its different i guess there are multiple displays for the home screen and it randomly cycles through these i would prefer to have a consistent home screen with my apps organized by me based on my preferencesthere is a preinstalled washing post app which while kind of nice continues to pop up on my home screen every day even though i remove it from my home every dayturning the wifi on and off is done in a separate wifi window rather than through a simple toggle on the initial pull down screenthe silk internet browser has many problems the first is the lack of a back and forward arrow you have to hit on an icon to access these rather than having them present on your search bar like in most internet browsers it glitches every single time i select the app it always opens a tab i went once on the first day i had the tablet i close it then go to the tab i wanted and it refreshes the tab i have selected this is fine for some sites like facebook but really annoying for others like if youre reading an article online and it keeps resetting to the top of the page also the browser has frozen on me a few times again doesnt seem like a big thing but the tablet is brand newthe amazon prime video app has glitched on me on the first day it has played the videos audio but only displayed a white screen restarting the tablet fixed it sometimes it doesnt keep my viewing progress uptodate for example when watching episodes of a tv show if you close the show out and come back into the show it loads up an episode from the previous seasonthe kindle reader almost always goes back to my bookshelf when i reselect the kindle window rather than resuming in the book i was currently reading the display options for the kindle are more limited than they were on my nexus for instance im not able to have the text presented in two columns like the pages of a book it can only be one column i suspect this is because of the size of the tablet screen and an assumption that two columns would not be pleasing on this small screenthe charger unit is also inconvenient it has the option of plugging into a computer via usb to charge or you can charge it through an electrical outlet unfortunately the configuration of the charger unit is bulky and unwieldy if you have it plugged into the top of an outlet it completely blocks the lower plug from useall of this said there are some things i like about the tablet its thicker than the nexus which gives you something more substantial to grip onto while reading its got good brightness control getting decently bright and dim for comfortable day or night reading its got good volume control it seems to take good pictures and videos the video camera on the nexus was almost always blurry it automatically saves these to a free cloud storage its got good processing speed it has good video resolution it is hd afterall it was a good price for what youre gettingtaking everything together the next time i need to buy a new tablet it sadly wont be a fire

fire osreviewthis review is aimed specifically at the major software update we just received not at the particular kindle fire modeli myself use an hdxwhich i love in terms of its hardware and until the system overhaul that osbrought had loved for its software as wellsince this review will be rather lengthy you can just read the headings that seam pertinent to youi will be reviewing this in terms of comparison and contrast with how it has improved or devolved since fire os topicslock screenpulldown menumain user interface uibuiltin appsbugs lock screenpros the lock screen has added a really nice feature allowing us to directly access the quick pulldown menu with wifi airplane mode etci will talk about the development of the pulldown menu in the next part of this reviewanother nice feature is the ability to directly access the camera app from the lock screen with a swipe from the bottom right cornercons as is the case with almost all the changes for osthe cons far outweigh the prosfirst the biggest problem with the lock screen is the loss of the direct ability to pause skip or go backseconds when listening to an audiobook or to music as we had beforeeven with access to the pulldown menu on the unlock screen we are not able to control playbackwe must unlock the screen first and then access the pulldown menu to access the playback controlsridiculousthe other major nuisance of the lock screen is the fact that the unlock swipe has been changed from a righttoleft swipe in the middle of the screen which allows for onehanded operation of a large tablet to a downtoup swipe from the middle of the bottom of the screen forcing twohand operation to unlock the tabletto add insult to injury this time fro the gesture to actual unlock seems to take longer than beforefinally i find it obnoxious that amazon added a quickswipe into shopping on the lockscreen as though accessing the amazon store is as essential as accessing the camera quicklyseems to me there are many other apps that deserve such a useful piece of lock screen real estate say email pulldown menupros this is one of the aspects of osthat is done pretty well overallit provides all of the most essential features wifi airplane mode blue shade do not disturb settings autorotate toggle mayday help and firefly to catch the name of that song on the radio quicklyblue shade is an excellent feature addition which allows us to use the fire before bedtime without the sleeppreventing overuse of blue lightthe blue shade removes the blue light turning the screen a reddish color and dimming it though you can easily adjust the redyellow balance and brightness to your likingcons the biggest con has to do with the implementation of audiobook playback controlsmusic playback controls are largely unchangedif you play a song then playback controls are added into the native pulldown menuhowever for audiobooks the playback controls are added as a white notification below the native pulldown menuthis has two disadvantagesfirst the controls are ultrasmall requiring superaccurate touchessecond i have not figured out what triggers its disappearance but the playback controls seem to randomly disappear from the notification sectionthe fact that i can even remove them from the notification while the audiobook is still playing is also weirdthey should be there permanently unless i actually quit the audiobook app as they were with os nonprocon this depends on preferencei like less options but others like moreif you own a kindle fire like owning an ipad you understand that you are losing customization choices with the osnevertheless some might be annoyed that there is no customizability with the actual pulldown menu’s native items though all of the notifications and priorities can be controlled through the app settings menu main user interface uiperhaps i’m using the wrong wording but when i say the main ui i simply refer to how the whole home screen tabs animations etc have been tweaked or more accurately mangled with os prosprobably the best new feature that was added to the interface is the addition of a small box icon next to the home circle and back arrow iconswhen the box is tapped you will get a carousel view of all running appsin fact this view has revealed either a new problem with the os or perhaps a problem that remained hidden in previous versions since there was no “app reveal” buttoni am including a screenshot of the problemas you will see the system seems to run duplicates once apps are openedi am only including an example that shows two of these music and settings but the problem persists across all builtin appsan app exists for settings as well as menus accessible from settings—wifi settings email settings parental controls etcmusic artists each take up an app tab the music library requires an app tab etcthus the system appears to be wasting a lot of resources running so many separate appsthe other possibility is that this is always the case in the os with the aim of speeding up launches but the end result is still an extremely cluttered app carouselwe only need one settings tab one music tab etcanother possible pro for some is the ability to change the home screen wallpaperi prefer the simplicity of the original dark gray screen of osless distracting when searching for a colorful app that could be lost in the colorful background but i was easily able to change the wallpaper to a simple gray to suit my needsothers may like the ability to put their own pictures or scenic backgrounds to more personalize the home pageconsperhaps the most egregious of the ui problems is the removal of a main tab for photos and docssome might argue that the docs tab gets less mainstream use but photos is undeniably one of the most frequently used apps for most usersnevertheless both photos and docs have been removed from the major tabs in the banner across the main screen while keeping a tab called “shop”that is to say in order to push for impulse buying amazon has removed the instant accessibility to photos in favor of keeping an entire tab dedicated to shoppinganother major change with the os is that instead of accessing tabs within the main screen each tab has been broken into separate appsphotos and docs have been removed from the tabs and exist only as separate apps that we can open from the home screen or from the apps tabthe result is more home screen clutterwhat is crazy is that all of the apps are stuck on the home screen…they can no longer be removed for a neater home screen the only workaround i have found is that i can combine them into their own “folder” so that instead of taking upapp spaces i can cull them intoapp folder spacewhile on the topic of the home screen it is also worth noting that we can no longer save our favorite books as an applike icon to the home screenfor example i read my bible every daypreviously this could just be seen immediately on my home screen next to my silk browser appnow i must go to the inconvenient recent tab discussed laterregarding the tabs music apps shop etc these have become less usefulpreviously you were brought directly to your library for the selected tab now the screen wastes resources animating a movement to a tab which shows you your most recently accessed apps but you must additionally tap “library” in order to see all of it which is exactly the same library interface we had on osthus two taps are required to do what was previously one tapthis is a small insignificant amount of time but the digression in usability is the bigger problemwhat happens when osrequires three taps then fourwhen accessing the apps tab the results are far more problematicseeing only five apps in the tab section we almost always have to view the library but the apps library has become horriblethe apps are not viewable as iconsinstead they are in a list form with their icon name downloadcloud status and a context menufirst of all this view makes it impossible to see more thanapps at a timesecond of all you can’t tap the app name or icon to open ittapping these will bring you to the app information page in the storeridiculousthis makes no sense from a ui perspectiveinstead the only way to open it is by tapping the tiny “open” button on the right sidei’m not sure how many felt about the carousel that previously dominated the home screeni loved itinstead this has been replaced by a recent tabi have two problems with thisone it now requires two taps instead of one to access the most recently usedappstwo the apps are organized in a vertical pane instead of a carousel though i know this is more habitvisual preference than a con with the system uii think that we should either have the option to activate a carousel into the home screen or the carousel should be added as a permanent strip between the tab titles and the apps on the home screeni think this is much more efficient than forcing me to either tap recent tab the boxappreveal icon or the other associated tab ie books for my biblethis is a small ui problem and easily fixablepreviously we had sliders for turning things like on or off eg the wifihowever they did not give a visual cue that they needed to be slidthey have changed these sliders to now look like slidersexcellent rightthe “sliders” are shown as small floating dot inside of an oval that is orange when the dot is on the left to indicate on and gray when the dot is on the right for offhowever a sliding motion does not move this dotinstead of sliding we must tap themit makes no senseif a tap is required the icon should not be shown as a slider it should be shown as a tapswitch otherwise the sliding motion we used in osshould be preserved to go with the much better visual slider cue builtin appsi will only speak about the system apps i use most frequently as i cannot comment on apps that i didn’t really use in os calculator this app has a huge new problemthey got rid of the “c” and “ce” buttonsthus as you tap out “” you can see the answer “” below it on the screen like any normal smartphone calculatorno need to tap ““ to find the answerbut how do you delete the numbersno “c” buttonyou must first tap “”the “del” which had only functioned as a backspace will then change to “clr” and then a really slow animation erases the answer so that you can begin a new problemthere is in fact space on the calculator to keep both the del and clr buttons visible at the same time without squeezing shrinking or removing any other keysclock the clock changes look nice but they don’t work nicerwhen you want to set an alarm clock for example you no longer get a big number keypad where you can tap out the time you wantinstead you get a tiny little clocklike circle of numbersto choose the hour to wakefor selecting the minutes you get the same clock circle for numbersthese numbers are so small and squeezed that it is not easy to tap out the right time on first touchworse if you want a time like pm you have to do a really difficult tap onthen slowly slide your finger until theappearsby the time you lift your finger you may accidentally change it toorfrom the movement during the lift of your fingertipthis is an easily fixable problemif they insist on keeping this interface because it is more attractive then a number pad then blow up the clock…use more screen real estatethen add little dots to represent the minutes between the minute increments currently showncamera i like how the camera added the ability to tap either a photograph shutter button or a video record button from the same menu without having to switch between camera and video modethis is an excellent enduser consideration to make when addingchanging a featurealso i’m not sure if we had hdr previously if not i’m glad this was addedat the very least the camera adds a “hdr recommended” text to the screen during camera mode if you do not have it activated but it might help the shot be betteremail this has become slightly streamlined making deletion of messages easier and making the composing icon more meaningful by changing it to an alwaysvisible pen in the bottom right corneri like the email client on here and i’m glad they didn’t tweak it too muchcalendar i haven’t used the calendar very much in the past or even nowthe reason it is useless when you set a reminder but the reminder does not remind youi want my calendar reminders to go off with their alarm and turn on my screen just like the alarm clock doesinstead you won’t see the reminder until you take the time to turn on your fire and look at your notificationsit works nicely in terms of its cloud connectedness and its interface if your requirements are relatively basic but its inability to wake the device up and actually remind me of events leaves its purposes moot at this point bugsi have encountered several bugs but cannot remember all of them at the momentthe only one i can remember at the moment happens when you have a folder of apps on the home screen and open that folder then open an app inside the folderonce in the app if you tap the home circle at the bottom of the screen it will bring you back to the home screen but it will automatically enter the keyboard mode trying to make you edit the name of the folder containing the app you just accessedconclusioni am aware of how long this review of osis but i hope that bears witness to how much i love amazon and how much i had loved my fire hdxbefore this attractive but nonuserfriendly oswas automatically downloaded and added to my devicei think that many user’s who read this will notice that they share in my dislike for many of the changesi am not against change i am simply against changes that do one or more of the followingfavor visual attractiveness over user friendliness animations just to animatereplace simplicity with unnecessary complexity two taps instead of oneoverlook simple design issues small buttons on large screensi think that amazon has made all three of these mistakes with the release of osmoreover i am really unhappy with how hard amazon has pushed shopping with the added swipe on the lock screen as well as with favoring a shop tab over a much more widely used tab like photosi feel like i signed up for having the ads on the lock screen when i bought this i knew accepted and sometimes even liked theseit keeps the lock screen from being boringhowever i feel like amazon is favoring its bank account more than the end user with these choices and it does not seem very amazonlike to meas a result i givestars for the hdxtablet itself butstars for oswhich makes thestar tablet work like a star tabletamazon has always been fantastic with customer service it is why i have remained a customer since its humble beginningsand i believe in amazon’s ability to fix these issuesthey have always done a great job responding to customer feedbacki really hope that by posting this review for those of you trying to decide between the fire hdvs fire hdthis may helpall i cared about between the two was the screen clarity and the sound clarity and volumeregarding the difference in the screen clarity there is just a hairs advantage to thenot much in it at all though the extra pixels per square inch make the hdjust a touch sharper but not enough in my eyes to pick it over the hd regarding sound i think thehas three advantages because it has two speakers and thehas but one it gets noticeably louder thealso has clearer sound to my ears though the difference in volume between the two units is much greater than the sound clarity perhaps most importantly the fire hdit has a speaker design advantage over the the fire hd speakers when the unit is turned landscape are located on either the top of the unit or the bottom of the unit depending on which end you hold up toward the sky in either case your hand will not block the speaker assuming you are holding it on the left and right edges and not the top and the bottom edgesthe fire hd when turned in landscape mode has the one speaker centered on either the left edge or the right edge again depending on which end is facing up bottom line when you hold the fire hd in landscape mode with one hand on the left and right edges you will cover the speaker with one finger or more it doesnt have that much of an impact on the volume or clarity of the sound but it does have someif you plan to listen to the unit largely with headphones or earbuds no big deal as both units sound the same the audio advantage of the hd really only comes into play when listening through the onboard speakersis it worth spending the extra money to get the better audio on the fire hd i think it is particularly if you plan to use the unit a fair amount without earbuds or headphones

right upfront i give the tablet itself five starsi am posting this one star review to draw attention to an issue i had with the certified refurbishedtablet i purchased the tablet arrived and looked brand newhowever when i tried to set up my accounts the tablet would only let me set up a childs accountno matter what i tried i could not get a regular account set upfrustrated and unhappy i called amazon who were happy to accept the return of course they could not refund my money until they actually received the return rightly so no problem therestill frustrated i left the tablet charging and went about my evenings tasksabout an hour later on its own the tablet started downloading a system updatecurious i let it runwhen it finished it restarted and whammo there was the interface i was expecting and i was able to set it up with no problemover the rest of the evening two more system updates took place and by the next morning i had a perfectly functioning tablet configured just the way i wanted itthe point of review is that if somewhere somehow i had been notified that system updates were needed it would have saved me time and a bunch of head scratching it would have also saved an amazon rep the time and effort it took to set up my returnso here is my buyer beware notificationrefurbished may not apply to the system software or installed apps for that matterskype is listed as an installed app but it was not installed on my tabletonce properly updated and configured the tablet itself is excellent as i expectedno need to go through with the return five stars for the tablet one star to amazon for lack of full disclosureupdateafterweeks i remain very happy with my updated tableti use it almost exclusively as a skype phone and for internet radiopodcastsi would recommend that if you plan on using it for anything else you should go with thegb version

i received the fire hdas a christmas gift first the good its a great size for reading ebooks i can hold it one handed which is perfect it also has a great screen for streaming video the amazon app store is kinda limited compared to google play but most major apps are there one thing though is the os that comes on the fire is kinda lanky luckily i searched about if its upgradeable to fire osand found out about the developer preview its pretty straightforward on how to sign up and receive the preview just do a search for fire hddeveloper preview and follow the directions you find fire osruns flawlessly on this tablet its much closer in looks to android which i find much better since i received this as a gift i didnt get to pick the amount of storage and i got the gb model its fine for my use though as i dont play many games on tablets or phones if all you use it for is reading books streaming video and serfing the web it works completely fine and all the major video streaming services are there also if you are a prime member its perfect for all the benefits you receive if you want some games though and have a choice id recommend that you get the gb modelnow the neither pro or con for me is the lock screen ads some people find them incredibly annoying i however dont find them annoying at all if they bug you that bad pay theand have them removednow to the negative the one major flaw is lack of a micro sd card slot while its great for streaming i cant download but one or two movies to watch without running out of storage while im almost always around wifi and can stream there are times that im not and would like to be able to have more that one and at the most two movies saved for offline viewing one other con is the lack of google play i understand that amazon is competitor to google and wants you to use their own apps and services its an annoyance to those of us who have apps and movies bought through google although it is possible to root and install google play or even not root and sideload the play store and play services to make it work it would be much less a hassle if it came on the fire in the first place oh and if you are wondering no i will not provide info on how to make that work just do a search and find a tutorial on how to but know that its a workaround and it may be buggy and an update from amazon may make it quit working at any time one last con are the cameras i tried to take a few pictures with it and they turned out terrible but i havent ever relied on a tablet for pictures though maybe if they would have left the rear camera off they could have made room for an sd card slotso thats my review if youre a prime member stream video from netflix hulu hbo now showtime or and other major streaming service or love to read its perfect the size is just right to hold one handedif you require google play a bigger screen and cant live without an sd slot or more storage this is not the device for for you move along and look elsewhere
